quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Massage and Body
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, discovery, exporter. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: As massage relaxes the body, relieves pain and reduces stress, it contributes to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Better sleep

questions.question: This is a natural healing method that uses the reflex points of the feet, which correspond to different organs and areas of the body.
As of the beginning of the new millennium, this was  the approximate number of Americans who receive a massage annually.
This technique is used to relax soft tissue. It is done using both hands, exercising light pressure.
There are different types of massage. Approximately how many?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: More than 150

questions.question: What happened to the tropical coral reefs during the 1998 and 2004 El Nino weather phenomenons?

options.text: Many of them were bleached or even killed
Nothing as they were all deep underwater

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Many of them were bleached or even killed

questions.question: A coral island, that consists of a coral reef, enclosing a depression in the centre is called this.
In December 2004, the discovery of the deepest coral reef in the United States was confirmed.  It is also the deepest coral reef in the world.
In this year massage therapy and bodywork were officially offered for the first time as a basic medical service, in Atlanta, GA.

An ancient Chinese book called The Inner Canon of Huangdi recommends breathing exercises, massage of the skin and flesh, and exercises of hands and feet as a remedy for complete paralysis, chills, and fever. Who was the author of this ancient book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yellow Emperor

questions.question: This country is the worlds largest exporter of corals.
What is the most common reason for getting a massage?
This is a new type of massage, introduced in 1990 by Hemi Hoani Fox. It originates from the Hawaiian Lomi-Lomi Nui dance and is believed to increase the energy flow within the body and mind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MA-URI massage

questions.question: The implementation of MPAs is one way to protect the coral reefs from destruction. What does MPA stand for in this context?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marine Protected Area

questions.question: Smooth strokes are enhanced by this substance, which is often used during a massage.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Anxiety and Depression
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, people, mood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following medications is effective for both depression and anxiety?
People with depression usually know they are depressed.
What system of the human body provides a site for blood cell formation?
Which of the following disorders is NOT a form of anxiety?
What is the predominant mood of a person with anxiety?
Which of the following sleep disorders is more typical of a person with depression?

options.text: Parasomnia (nightmares, sleepwalking, or other violent behaviors while sleeping)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Late insomnia (difficulty staying asleep)

questions.question: Cells are the building blocks of life. In humans and other multicellular organisms, cells depend on one another and cooperate to maintain homeostasis in the body. Groups of cells that are similar in structure and function are called tissues. What tissue protects the underlying tissues in areas subjected to abrasion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stratified squamous epithelium

questions.question: A cells life cycle is the series of changes the cell goes through from the time it is formed until it reproduces itself. It includes two stages. What are these two stages?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cell division and interphase

questions.question: People with anxiety usually know they have anxiety.
Depression and anxiety are considered mood disorders.  Which of the following is also considered a mood disorder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bipolar Disorder

questions.question: Of the following medications for anxiety, which is potentially addictive?

Architecturally, our skin is a wonder. It is tough yet pliable, a characteristic that enables it to withstand constant insult from outside agents. Is the skin considered a system of the human body despite its extent and complexity?

A scheme, commonly used by anatomists, divides the abdominal surface and abdominopelvic cavity into nine separate regions by four planes. One of this is the Lumbar region. It is located between the ribs and the flaring portions of the hip bones which is flanking the epigastric region.
Which of the following lists of symptoms is typical of a person with depression?

options.text: Seeing things that arent there, hearing voices when no one is present, and displaying emotions different from those that one is actually feeling.
Irritability, fatigue, insomnia, difficulty concentrating, restlessness, and headaches
Racing thoughts, decreased need for sleep, euphoric mood, risk-taking behaviors, and irritability
Fatigue, difficulting concentrating, loss of interest in usual activities, poor appetite, guilt, and insomnia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fatigue, difficulting concentrating, loss of interest in usual activities, poor appetite, guilt, and insomnia

questions.question: Which of the following people is generally at the highest risk of suicide?

options.text: A depressed housewife with a disabled child
A divorced, unemployed man living alone
A single mother with 4 children who is on welfare

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A divorced, unemployed man living alone

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: System and Computer
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, bellies, brain. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What capabilities are indicated when the specifications read DVD±RW/CD-RW?

options.text: No capabilities are indicated. This is a programming language.
There are two disc drives, one for DVD and one for CD.
The computer is able to read and rewrite to CDs and DVDs.
The DVD and CD drive is removable

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The computer is able to read and rewrite to CDs and DVDs.

questions.question: GigaBytes or GB is the measurement used to determine the processor speed.
Which of the following types of brain cells amplify the neural signals and maintain homeostasis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: glial cells

questions.question: Which one of these items is more valuable as far as meeting the requirements for 3-D Gaming is concerned?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: PCI Express video card

questions.question: If a computer has an integrated sound card, you will not need speakers to hear sounds (such as music or sound effects) through your system.
The correct way to measure the size of a widescreen monitor or laptop display is by length of the longer side.
The companies Intel and AMD are primarily known for their development and manufacturing of what?

The digestive system provides the body with the nutrients essential for health. The organs of this system ingest, digest, and absorb food and eliminate the undigested remains as feces. The oral cavity, parotid gland, sublingual gland, tongue, pharynx, larynx and oesophagus are constituents of this system.
A computer that has wireless 802.11b/g or a Nic card needs nothing else to connect to the Internet.
What is the name of the flat panel monitors that became increasingly popular around 2005?
Which one of these is an operating system?
What is the name for a port used to connect peripheral devices (such as keyboards, mouses and digital cameras) to a computer?

In the human body, the pulmonary circulation differs in many ways from systemic circulation because it does not serve the metabolic needs of the body tissues. Which of the following is the true sequence of the pulmonary circulation?

options.text: Pulmonary trunk - left pulmonary artery - lobar arteries of the left lung - right atrium - right pulmonary artery - left ventricle
Right atrium - right ventricle - pulmonary arteries - arterioles - capillaries - venules - pulmonary veins - left atrium - left ventricle
Left ventricle - left lung - right lung - lobar arteries of the left atrium - pulmonary trunk
Left atrium - left pulmonary artery - left pulmonary veins - lobar arteries of the left lung - left ventricle - left ventricle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right atrium - right ventricle - pulmonary arteries - arterioles - capillaries - venules - pulmonary veins - left atrium - left ventricle

questions.question: Bone surfaces are not featureless and smooth but are scarred with an array of bumps, holes, and ridges called bone markings.   What is the name of a bone marking which is very large, blunt and irregularly shaped?
If I am a superficial muscle of the human body having two prominent bellies, then where am I located?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Brain and Following
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, brainstem, ericksson. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This evolutionary theory, proposed by the inimitable Stephen J. Gould and Niles Eldridge, argues that evolution occurs not gradually but rapidly after periods of stasis and in isolated, localized areas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Punctuated Equilibrium

questions.question: Which of the following is not part of the group of brain-supplying arteries, known as the circle of Willis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: basilar artery

questions.question: The meninges, a system of membranes that envelop the central nervous system, consist of three layers. Which of the following is not  a name of a layer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: grey mater

questions.question: In 1912, a jawbone and fragments of a skull were discovered and originally named “dawn-man”.  It wasn’t until 41 years later that it was exposed as a hoax. This darling of creationist skepticism is known as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piltdown Man

questions.question: There are twelve cranial nerves, two of which do not join the brainstem. Which are these two nerves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: olfactory and optical

questions.question: Which part of the brain, located inside the temporal lobe, is associated with memory formation?
What is the total collection of traits that determine the physical and behavioral aspects of an organism called?
Which of the following is part of the brainstem, a stalk of the brain below the celebral hemispsheres?

Prior to Darwin’s theory, the most influential line of thought regarding the variety of life forms was a creationist doctrine that likened the biological functions in an organism to the intricate workings of a watch. Which Christian apologist put forth the “Watchmaker Analogy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Paley

questions.question: Fred Gage and Peter Ericksson discovered and announced that adult human brain produces new brain cells. In what year did they make their discovery?
The evolutionary process where beneficial inherited traits become more prevalent in the succeeding generations of organisms, and unfavorable ones less common, is called what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natural Selection

questions.question: Which of the following is part of the frontal lobe, an area at the front of each cerebral hemisphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: precental gyrus

questions.question: This scientist, winner of the 1908 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, was the first to notice the existence of blood-brain barrier.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Ehrlich

questions.question: This three million year old skeleton known as “Lucy” was discovered in 1974 and is almost 40% complete. Lucy was a small, chimp-like hominid but walked upright like modern humans. She is a member of this species.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australopithecus Afarensis

questions.question: Which term refers to the cephalic disorder, characterised by absence of the celebral hemispheres?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Input and Text
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, printer, bullet. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Keyboards are used for the input of text and characters.
What does the equation y = mx + b represent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A line

questions.question: This animals evolutionary lineage is the best documented and the most clearly understood.
A flatbed scanner enables users to put a text or a computer-generated image on paper or on another medium, such as a transparency.
In trigonometry, the tangent is defined as what?

options.text: The ratio of the side adjacent to the angle to the side opposite the angle
The sine divided by the cosine
The negative logarithm of the cotangent

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The sine divided by the cosine

questions.question: A modem is both an input and an output device.
This monastic egghead pioneered the study of genetics, which eventually explained the mechanisms of speciation through genetic mutation. Who is the “father of modern genetics?”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gregor Mendel

questions.question: In geometry, which angles are called opposite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Equal angles

questions.question: The “peppered moth” is a prime example of micro evolution, where the moth’s color changed over a span of 200 years to match the soot-darkened trunks of the trees it inhabits. The darker moths survived because they were less conspicuous than their white counterparts to the birds that preyed on them.  What is the term associated with the coloration change demonstrated in the peppered moth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Industrial Melanism

questions.question: If you are solving a word problem for 2 unknowns, how many equations will you need?

During his famous voyage to the Galapagos Islands, Charles Darwin studied differences in a specific animal’s anatomy, his observations setting the stage for his eventual theory of evolution. What animal’s anatomy did Darwin study?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finch beaks

questions.question: What is the path taken by a bullet fired from a rifle into the air (ignoring friction)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A parabola

questions.question: Which of these represents the locus of points, the sum of whose distances from two given points is equal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An ellipse

questions.question: A printer is an input device used to scan photos, pictures, texts and other printed material.
Which of these is an output device that produces audible sound?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: System and Solar System
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, jupiter, lack. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Because of the lack of atmosphere, the craters on most celestial bodies from the solar system remain preserved for hundreds of millions or billions of years. The largest known crater within the solar system is located on which natural satellite?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Moon

questions.question: This celestial body is the darkest of Uranus larger moons and its most distinctive feature is a large equatorial ring of bright material (supposedly a crater) named Wunda, which contrasts with the rest of the planet’s dark surface.
Which of these characteristics makes Saturns moon Titan unique among all moons in the solar system?

options.text: It is the only moon that is considered a captured object.
It is the only moon with active volcanoes on its surface.
It is the only moon to have a retrograde orbit.
It is the only moon to have a dense atmosphere.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the only moon to have a dense atmosphere.

questions.question: Which is the planet with the biggest number of natural satellites in the solar system?
What is the symbol for Hydrogen?
Which of the following is an arithmetic progression?
In geometry, what is the value of the number which is represented by the Greek letter pi (π)?

options.text: The ratio of the circumference of a circle to its radius
The ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter
The ratio of the diameter of a circle to its radius

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter

questions.question: Larger than Pluto and Mercury, this natural satellite is the largest moon of the entire solar system.
Named after the leading sylph in Alexander Popes poem Rape of the Lock, the moon Ariel is the natural satellite of which planet of the solar system?
Which of the four Galilean moons of Jupiter is noted as the most volcanically active body in the solar system?
Which of the following statements about quadrilaterals (4-sided figures) is true?

options.text: A parallelogram is a type of trapezoid.
A rhombus is a type of rectangle.
A rectangle is a type of square.
A square is a type of parallelogram.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A square is a type of parallelogram.

questions.question: Choose the statement which best describes the Pythagorean Theorem.

options.text: The hare will never catch up to the tortoise.
There exist no whole numbers a, b and c for which the sum of the cubes of a and b equals the cube of c.
The square of the hypotenuse of a right triangle equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The square of the hypotenuse of a right triangle equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides.

questions.question: What is the symbol for Nickel?
There have been numerous debates over whether this moon, discovered in 1978, should be considered a satellite or a separate planet.
What is the symbol for Krypton?
